column3: Never (only before the first bell and after the last bell)
column4: Students keep their phones on their person in a locked pouch (such as a Yondr)
column10: We initially faced pushback from students who thought it was unfair, but within the first month they came around to the idea and now it has become a norm.
column11: We use a three-tier enforcement system. The first time they are caught, students receive a warning. The second time, we call their parents and keep their phone in the office for the rest of the week. If they are caught a third time, we keep their phone in the office for the rest of the school year.
column21: Large public school in a suburban area
column36: It is great to see students interacting with each other more. The hallways are so much louder now that they are talking.
column37: The phone policy has been very successful
column38: This policy has improved the social climate at school - students are much more interactive, which is nice.
